stock_data.ds_id: Meta Platforms' Epic 2023 Continues, Is It Too Late to Buy the Stock@The Motley Fool@META
stock_data.data: Meta Platforms, the parent company of Facebook, has seen its share prices drop by nearly 15% despite beating financial expectations for Q3 2023. The drop has raised questions about the company's profit margin expansion and whether it presents a buying opportunity. Meta's use of AI has boosted productivity and revenue growth, but concerns over war, economic worries, and a lawsuit have overshadowed its positive performance. The company's outlook for Q4 and expected increase in capital expenditure for 2024 have also dampened investor sentiment. However, CEO Mark Zuckerberg has indicated that Meta's focus on operating efficiently will continue.

stock_data.ds_id: Meta is culpable in teen mental health crisis, lawsuit says@MLivecom@META
stock_data.data: A coalition of state attorneys general, including Michigan, have filed a lawsuit against Meta Platforms Inc., the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, claiming that the company has misled the public about the dangers of its social media platforms and ignored the damage they have caused to the mental health of young users. The lawsuit accuses Meta of engaging in deceptive and unlawful conduct and violating state and federal law. The lawsuit is based on confidential material not yet available to the public, but documents made public by former Meta employees reportedly show that the company purposely made its platforms addictive to children and teens. The lawsuit argues that Meta's platforms have harmed young people's physical and mental health, including their ability to get adequate sleep, and that the company failed to disclose the harm or make meaningful changes to minimize it. However, it is noted that the harm lies in how teens use the platforms, what they view, and other mental health risk factors they may have. Parents are encouraged to be aware of what their children are viewing and how they use technology and social media, and to monitor, supervise, and educate them on the harmful aspects of these platforms.

stock_data.ds_id: Meta Is To Blame For The Teen's Mental Health Crisis, The Lawsuit Alleges@Nation World News@META
stock_data.data: A coalition of state attorneys general, including Michigan, has filed a lawsuit against Meta Platforms Inc., the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, over the alleged negative impact of the platforms on children's mental health. The lawsuit accuses Meta of misleading the public about the dangers of social media and prioritizing profit over the well-being of young users. The lawsuit claims that Meta made its platforms addictive to children and teenagers, causing harm to their physical and mental health. However, a children's services manager emphasized that social media itself is not inherently bad, but rather how it is used and the content consumed. Parents are encouraged to monitor and educate their children on the potential harmful aspects of social media.

stock_data.ds_id: Facebook blocks page of the Palestine Committee of Norway WSWS@WSWS@META
stock_data.data: The Facebook page of the Palestine Committee of Norway in Trøndelag has been shut down by Meta (formerly Facebook). This act of censorship is seen as a violation of democratic freedom of expression and is part of a larger trend of censorship targeting pro-Palestinian voices around the world. Members and supporters of the Palestine Committee are protesting against this act of censorship. The conversation with Magnus Barka Hjelle, leader of the local Students for Palestine group, revealed that many governments in NATO countries are viewed as enemies of the Palestinians, but the population generally supports them. The conversation also discussed the origins of Israel as a colonial project and the potential for a one-state solution in the future. The article emphasizes the importance of the fight against censorship and the defense of democratic rights in the international movement against oppression and war.

stock_data.ds_id: Facebook ads scamming customers with fake discounts, says Vancouver Island puzzle company CBCca@CBCca@META
stock_data.data: The Cobble Hill Puzzle Company, a popular puzzle company in Canada, is being impersonated by fraudulent Facebook ads claiming that the company is going out of business. The ads offer deep discounts on puzzles and other products and have led to confused customers making purchases through a fraudulent website. Cobble Hill Puzzle Company is actually experiencing continued success and has been fielding over 20 messages a day from customers who believed the ads were legitimate. The company's reputation has been impacted, and it has been difficult to get the ads taken down or receive a response from Facebook support. The B.C. Chamber of Commerce highlights that cybercrime, including scams on social media, is poorly understood by businesses and local law enforcement. They recommend reporting incidents to the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security, the RCMP, or the Canadian Anti-Fraud Centre.

stock_data.ds_id: New Tech Stock Rally Expected to Impact Mutual Fund Performance, Says Goldman Sachs@Clayton County Register @META
stock_data.data: Goldman Sachs predicts that the recent surge in value of major US technology stocks will negatively impact mutual fund performance, with the trend likely to continue. The average large-cap fund is currently below the weight of the top-performing technology stocks, known as the "Magnificent Seven", which include Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, Nvidia, Meta Platforms, and Tesla. The strong performance of these stocks has dragged down mutual fund performance, and if the trend continues, mutual fund managers could face concentration risks. Despite portfolio managers increasing their exposure to these stocks, diversification requirements limit their ability to match the benchmark weight. Goldman Sachs believes that if their macro forecasts for 2024 are realized, the tech stock group will continue to outperform, but there are potential risks to their continued success, including elevated positioning and high expectations around artificial intelligence.

stock_data.ds_id: The CJEU's judgement in Meta Platforms Inc v Bundeskartellamt: the spotlight on lawful bases for processing data@Fieldfisher@META
stock_data.data: The recent judgment by the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) has significant implications for social media companies and data controllers. The judgment clarifies the strict approach to legal bases for personalized advertising and asserts that unlawful data processing by dominant companies may constitute an abuse of market position. This decision has already led to regulatory enforcement actions, such as a temporary ban on Meta's behavioral advertising in Norway. The impact on social media business models is evident, with Meta introducing a subscription model to give users the option to pay and avoid targeted ads. The CJEU's findings also address other aspects, such as processing for network security and compliance with law enforcement requests, as well as the application of Article 9 GDPR in a social media context.

stock_data.ds_id: Unredacted complaint against Meta Platforms Inc and Instagram LLC released, NH AG says@Yahoo News@META
stock_data.data: New Hampshire Attorney General John Formella has released the unredacted complaint against Meta Platforms Inc. and Instagram LLC, revealing allegations that Meta intentionally designs features on Instagram and Facebook to harm children. The complaint exposes Meta's knowledge of the harms inflicted on kids and its active efforts to exploit vulnerabilities for profit. Key revelations include Meta's revenue from New Hampshire users and its manipulation of design elements despite claiming user well-being as a priority. Meta's misleading safety statistics and Mark Zuckerberg's veto on banning harmful photo filters are also highlighted.

stock_data.ds_id: New Hampshire Releases Unredacted Complaint Against Meta Platforms Inc and Instagram LLC@TickerTV News@META
stock_data.data: The New Hampshire Attorney General, John Formella, has publicly released an unredacted complaint against Meta Platforms Inc. and Instagram LLC. The lawsuit, part of a bipartisan coalition of 41 attorneys general, alleges that Meta intentionally designed harmful features on Instagram and Facebook, causing addiction and detrimental effects on children's well-being. Meta's acknowledgment of harm, exploitation of teen psychology, promotion of passive use, and misleading safety statistics are revealed. The unredacted complaint strengthens the case, prompting questions about social media giants' ethics and practices.

stock_data.ds_id: Judge Sides With FTC In Fight With Meta Over Teens' Data 11292023@MediaPost@META
stock_data.data: A federal judge has rejected Meta Platforms' bid to prevent the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) from banning the company from monetizing minors' data. The ruling means that Meta and the FTC will have to face an administrative hearing over proposed changes to a 2020 settlement. Meta is considering its legal options and plans to fight the "unlawful attempt" to rewrite the agreement. The FTC proposed prohibiting Meta from using minors' data for ad targeting or algorithms following identified weaknesses in the company's privacy program and coding errors that allowed children to communicate with unapproved users.

stock_data.ds_id: Google takes on Meta, this time with its messenger platform@The Financial Express@META
stock_data.data: Google's RCS messaging platform is gaining traction among businesses in India, including AJio, HDFC Bank, and Mamaearth, presenting a strong competitor to WhatsApp's business features. If the current momentum continues, RCS could significantly narrow the gap with WhatsApp in the next two years. RCS allows rich media communication, and its lower cost compared to WhatsApp is driving enterprise adoption. With 20-25% of enterprises already using RCS, the industry anticipates a shift of 25-30% of SMS volumes to RCS over the next 18-24 months. The platform's regulatory alignment and lower expenses contribute to its appeal for businesses. RCS faces challenges in terms of reach, as it requires activation by smartphone makers and is not supported on iPhones. Despite this, RCS is expected to generate over $15 billion in additional messaging revenue for operators globally between 2024 and 2028.

stock_data.ds_id: Protecting Children Online: Finding a Balance Between Profit and Wellbeing@TickerTV News@META
stock_data.data: The article discusses a lawsuit filed by 41 state attorneys general and the District of Columbia against Meta, the parent company of Facebook, accusing it of exploiting younger users for profit. The lawsuit focuses on Meta's alleged prioritization of growth over the well-being of teenagers and claims that the company's internal documents show a profit-centered mindset. The attorneys general argue that Meta's lax approach to enforcing age restrictions leads to the unauthorized collection of data from underage users. While the arguments regarding children under 13 are legally sound, those regarding teenagers aged 13 and above are less likely to succeed. The article suggests that legislative action should be taken to address the excessive use of social media by young people while carefully considering First Amendment rights and avoiding broad liability on platforms. Measures such as automatic alerts and greyscale mode could encourage healthier behavior, but they should be supported by scientific research and go beyond legal requirements. The ultimate decision lies with the court and Congress, where long-lasting solutions can be implemented to protect children online.

stock_data.ds_id: Google, Meta, Qualcomm: What's Brewing Behind Their Unseen Tech Coalition Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG), Alph@Benzinga@META
stock_data.data: Google, Meta Platforms, Qualcomm, and seven other tech companies have established the Coalition for Open Digital Ecosystems (CODE) to support open digital platforms and systems in response to new EU technology regulations. The alliance aims to promote innovation and growth in Europe and focuses on implementing the Digital Markets Act and future EU regulatory frameworks. The DMA requires large tech companies to allow third-party interoperation with their services and enable business users to operate independently. CODE's formation is a strategic move to shape digital ecosystem policies and potentially influence legislation. CODE's membership includes Honor, Lenovo, Lynx, Motorola, Nothing, Opera, and Wire. The coalition's objectives include cross-industry collaboration, seamless connectivity, and interoperable systems.

stock_data.ds_id: Google, Meta Join Push for Digital Openness as EU Regulation Takes Aim at Tech Giants@Investopedia@META
stock_data.data: Google, Meta, and other tech companies have formed an alliance called the Coalition for Open Digital Ecosystems (CODE) as the European Union (EU) tightens regulations on big tech. The CODE's goal is to provide thought leadership on digital openness and support the implementation of the EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA). The initial members of the coalition include Google, Meta, Motorola, Opera, Qualcomm, Lynx, Nothing, Wire, Honor, and Lenovo. The DMA imposes stricter regulations on "gatekeepers" such as Google, Meta, Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft, with potential fines and other penalties for non-compliance.

stock_data.ds_id: Instagram Reels outperforms TikTok, Facebook for branded video content, report says@Marketing Dive@META
stock_data.data: Emplifi's research reveals that branded video content on Instagram Reels surpasses TikTok and Facebook in performance. Longer Reels, over 90 seconds, have double the median video views compared to TikTok. Reels outshine Instagram's Stories, delivering six times the reach. Emplifi suggests incorporating more Reels in social marketing plans for 2024. Despite this, advertisers posted five times as many Stories as Reels in 2023, emphasizing the need for a shift in advertiser behavior to capitalize on Instagram's potential. Emplifi's CMO, Zarnaz Arlia, highlights untapped opportunities for brands embracing Instagram's video strategy, emphasizing the importance of producing entertaining and valuable content to engage audiences. Consumers increasingly spend time on social videos, with a 15% increase over three years, making it a crucial format. While video length matters on Instagram, it's less critical on TikTok. Instagram Reels with longer lengths significantly outperform TikTok, with Instagram's push to prioritize Reels contributing to the substantial difference in views. Facebook Reels mirrors Instagram's success, attracting over three times the median views of other video content on the platform.

stock_data.ds_id: Mint Explainer: How Meta’s Threads could boost the rise of a new social internet | Mint@Mint@META
stock_data.data: The Fediverse, a network of interconnected social media platforms, is gaining traction as a decentralized alternative to traditional social media. Meta's Threads platform recently announced its intention to become part of the Fediverse, using the same standard protocol as Mastodon, and embracing the decentralized approach of the internet's future. The advantages of the Fediverse include redundancy and resilience, interoperability, user privacy, and a lack of targeted advertising. However, challenges include fragmentation, varying moderation policies, scalability, and a smaller network effect compared to centralized social networks. The adoption of Threads into the Fediverse is seen as a validation of the movement towards decentralized social media and may pressure larger platforms to provide better, less exploitative services.

Factors include a slide in last year's tech giants, rising Treasury yields, and concerns over iPhone demand. The first trading day of 2024 saw a halt to the 2023 S&P 500 rally. Analysts differ in their outlook, with some expecting a breather and others anticipating a continued advance, while the market awaits Fed minutes and economic data. The article also mentions global events impacting markets, including an earthquake in Japan, Bitcoin's climb, and China's economic challenges.

stock_data.ds_id: Tech Titans Tumble: 'Magnificent Seven' Shed 250 Billion in Market Cap On 2024 Day One Apple (NASDAQ:A@Benzinga@META
stock_data.data: On the first trading day of 2024, the market capitalization of the so-called "Magnificent Seven" high-growth tech companies dropped by $250 billion. Apple saw the sharpest decline, losing $116 billion, after a sell call from a Barclays analyst downgraded the company. Other tech titans, including Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, NVIDIA, and Tesla, also saw their market caps decrease. The tech sector as a whole was impacted, with the Invesco QQQ Trust falling by 2.2%. The market is pausing due to ongoing economic and geopolitical risks, such as tensions in global trade and a request for ASML Holdings to halt chip machine shipments to China.

stock_data.ds_id: Ohio Looks To Take On Social Media—But The Platforms Are Fighting Back@Forbes@META
stock_data.data: A new law in Ohio that would have required children to obtain parental consent before using social media apps has been challenged in court. The law, part of the state's budget bill, was signed into law last July but has been blocked pending a court hearing next month. Tech trade group NetChoice, which represents companies like TikTok, Snapchat, and Facebook's Meta, filed a lawsuit against the law, arguing that it violates free speech and is overly broad and vague. NetChoice has previously won lawsuits against similar restrictions in Arkansas and California. It is unclear how the case will play out, but experts suggest that regardless of the outcome, other states are likely to introduce similar laws to address children's access to social media. Some experts argue that parental involvement and awareness are more effective than legal restrictions in protecting children online.

stock_data.ds_id: Over 100,000 Children Are Sent Sex Abuse Material On Facebook And Instagram Every Day, Claims Lawsuit@NDTV@META
stock_data.data: Internal documents from Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, revealed that an estimated 100,000 minors receive sexually explicit content daily. The documents, presented in a lawsuit by New Mexico, allege Meta's platforms recommend sexual content to underage users and connect child users with potential predators through algorithms. Over 40 US states have sued Meta, claiming it misled the public about platform dangers, while Meta announced plans to restrict harmful content for teen accounts automatically. Meta denied accusations, stating New Mexico mischaracterized their work.

Instagram was highlighted as particularly problematic, with "sex talk" 38 times more prevalent than on Facebook Messenger. New Mexico is suing Meta for failing to address predation on its platform, and Meta is facing lawsuits from 41 states for harming the mental health of young users.

stock_data.ds_id: Florida House ready to pass social media restrictions@CBS News@META
stock_data.data: The Florida House is set to pass a bill (HB 1) preventing children under 16 from using social media, citing harms to their mental health. The bill requires age verification for account creation and termination of existing accounts for minors. Critics, including Meta and NetChoice, argue it's unconstitutional and raises data privacy concerns. The bill is a priority for Speaker Paul Renner but faces opposition over parents' rights and potential First Amendment violations. Another bill (HB 3) requiring age verification to restrict minors' access to explicit content online was also approved by the Judiciary Committee.

stock_data.ds_id: Spanish court rules Facebook moderator suffered workrelated mental trauma@AOL@META

stock_data.data: Meta Platforms, Inc. CEO Mark Zuckerberg shared on Instagram the company's long-term vision to develop artificial general intelligence (AGI) surpassing human intelligence. Zuckerberg aims to make the AGI widely accessible, allowing others to build their own chatbots. Meta is investing in infrastructure, including ordering 350,000 Nvidia graphics cards for AGI processing power. OpenAI and Google have cautioned against open-source AGI due to potential misuse for spreading misinformation. Zuckerberg envisions widespread AI interaction through devices like Meta's Ray-Ban smart glasses. OpenAI is also pursuing AGI development.

stock_data.ds_id: S&P 500 Shatters Records: The TopPerforming Stocks In January 2024@Business Insider@META
stock_data.data: The S&P 500 has reached a new all-time high at 4,839 points, driven by U.S. tech giants and AI-related stocks. The Federal Reserve's pause in tightening cycles suggests potential interest rate cuts in 2024. Top gainers include NVIDIA, Meta Platforms, and Advanced Micro Devices, with triple-digit percentage gains in 2023. The largest contributors to the index's year-to-date performance include NVIDIA, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Broadcom, and Advanced Micro Devices.

stock_data.ds_id: USD 419698 billion growth in Social Commerce Market from 2022 to 2027; The market is fragmented due to the @IT News Online@META
stock_data.data: The social commerce market is projected to grow by USD 4196.98 billion between 2022 and 2027, at a CAGR of 31%. This growth is attributed to the fragmented market landscape, populated by major companies like Advance, Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., and Automattic Inc. Key factors driving this growth include the integration of online storefronts with social shopping apps, influential social media marketing, and an increased focus on personalized shopping experiences. The Asia Pacific region is expected to be a significant contributor to this growth.
